you can't.  GNOME changed how gdm worked in recent releases, and it no longer supports the themes for prior versions.
:O! That seems like a very backwards step :/. Is there any way to install new themes? Rather than GDM? GTK maybe...? Or is it not possible at all?
I vaugely recall that you might be able to setup a default gtk theme to take effect, but I don't know how to do that.
